content:
I'll need this for myself, being a first-timer in Atlanta, but with luck we'll point to this thread often, as more and more people become aware of FHIR, whether they're consumers looking for app info etc, or patient innovators.

Here is the 31 page PDF introduction to HL7 and the Atlanta conference.

What other things will newcomers need, either for Atlanta or FHIR in general?

Four days later, no answer - help! As far as I can tell, I don't even have any info on where to go upon arrival! The only thing I know is "it's in the hotel"! What floor? What ballroom? Etc.

(Experience as a speaker has taught me that clubby organizations sometimes don't post clear instructions for newbies because "everybody knows.")

Here is the /firsttime page on hl7.org .... @#$(*&!@#, it's not for first-timers - it redirects to a page of WGMs etc! WTH!

I'll need this for myself, being a first-timer in Atlanta, but with luck we'll point to this thread often, as more and more people become aware of FHIR, whether they're consumers looking for app info etc, or patient innovators.

Here is the 31 page PDF introduction to HL7 and the Atlanta conference.

What other things will newcomers need, either for Atlanta or FHIR in general?
Do we need to create a formal Hospitality WG? :-) It's necessary, if we want to do outreach beyond our existing space.
Marriott Marquis floor ‚ÄúML‚Äù. I had a hard time finding it too. Even the hotel did not know where it was. üò£
Normally we count on the hotel to direct people. Also, normally we're in a smaller hotel so we're pretty much the only game going on...
The FHIR agenda for the week is here: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/FHIR+WGM+Agendas+2019-09

I created a video to help some of my Columbia students orient to HL7 so they can participate in calls. Thought it might be useful to some of you here: https://transcripts.gotomeeting.com/#/s/4bd8cc65fdb41105240611ae8a51531e5269128fd989355f7413f9d4b45ac5e9
